alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Cleveland; Custer; Grady; Kingfisher; Lincoln; Logan; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie; Seminole; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 1:24AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Washita, southern Kingfisher, northern Grady, northern Caddo, Oklahoma, Lincoln, southeastern Custer, southern Blaine, southern Logan, Canadian, northwestern Seminole, northern Cleveland and northern Pottawatomie Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 123 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northeast of Stroud to 6 miles south of Wellston to 7 miles southeast of Clinton. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oklahoma City, Edmond, Moore, Midwest City, Shawnee, Del City, El Reno, Weatherford, Guthrie, Kingfisher, Chandler, Yukon, Bethany, Mustang, Choctaw, Warr Acres, The Village, Tuttle, Piedmont, and Harrah. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 117 and 160. Interstate 40 between mile markers 69 and 196. Interstate 44 between mile markers 110 and 182. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Cleveland; Custer; Grady; Kingfisher; Lincoln; Logan; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie; Seminole; Washita
